starvationevasion.common.gamecards

Class GameCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.common.gamecards.GameCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, JSON, Sendable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Policy_CleanRiverIncentive, Policy_CovertIntelligence, Policy_DivertFunds, Policy_DiverttheFunds, Policy_EducateTheWomenCampaign, Policy_EfficientIrrigationIncentive, Policy_EthanolTaxCreditChange, Policy_FarmInfrastructureSubSaharan, Policy_FertilizerAidCentralAsia, Policy_FertilizerAidMiddleAmerica, Policy_FertilizerAidOceania, Policy_FertilizerAidSouthAsia, Policy_FertilizerAidSubSaharan, Policy_FertilizerSubsidy, Policy_Filibuster, Policy_Filibuster, Policy_FoodReliefCentralAsia, Policy_FoodReliefMiddleAmerica, Policy_FoodReliefOceania, Policy_FoodReliefSouthAsia, Policy_FoodReliefSubSaharan, Policy_Fundraiser, Policy_Fundraiser, Policy_InternationalFoodRelief, Policy_Loan, Policy_MyPlatePromotionCampaign, Policy_Redraft, Policy_ResearchInsectResistanceGrain, Policy_SearchforAnswers, Policy_SharedKnowledge, Policy_SpecialInterests

    public abstract class GameCard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sendable
    GameCard is the structure used by the Client, Server and Simulator. It holds all the data needed by the Simulator to implement the effects of a a policy drafted and enacted by a player.

    The game client's might want to extend this a class adding, for example, an image, a status (in deck, in hand, proposed, voting, enacted, rejected) and other data.

    If the client does extend this class, DO NOT send the extended class to the Server. This will cause the transmission of unused data causing needed network lag. Rather, use the clone(GameCard source) method to create a new GameCard that will copy the parts of your extended gameCard that actually need to be sent.

    Use the validate() method to verify all needed parameters of the policy are defined in range.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static GameCard create(EnumRegion owner,
                              EnumPolicy type)
        This is a convenience method used to construct any of the many policy cards available in the game.
        Parameters:
        owner - US player region controlled by the player who drafts this policy.
        type - The policy card type to be constructed.
        Returns:
        new instance of a policy card.

      • votesRequired

        public int votesRequired()
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default behavior of a gamecard card (votesRequired() = 0). If a class extending GameCard is not automatic, then it must override this method.
        Returns:
        0 if the policy is automatic. Otherwise, returns the number of votes required for the policy to be enacted.
        Note: This will always return a number that is no smaller than the number of regions returned by getRegionsEligibleToVote().

      • actionPointCost

        public int actionPointCost(EnumPolicy policy)
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the action point cost of a given policy type.

      • getFlavorText

        public java.lang.String getFlavorText()
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default flavor text of a card. Initially, this String is null, but any card that will have flavor text will override this method to return the selected String of text.

        Note: Not every card is guaranteed to have flavor text, so this may return null.

      • getFlavorTextSource

        public java.lang.String getFlavorTextSource()
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default source of where the flavor text is. Often, the flavor text is a quote, so the source will look something like "-Ronald Reagan".

        Note: Not every card's flavor text will have a source, so this may return null.

      • voteWaitForAll

        public boolean voteWaitForAll()
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default behavior of a policy card (voteWaitForAll() = false). If a class extending GameCard is not automatic and requires waiting, then it must override this method.
        Returns:
        true if voting should continue until all eligible players have voted on this policy. Return false if voting should stop as soon as the required number of votes have been reached.

      • isEligibleToVote

        public boolean isEligibleToVote(EnumRegion playerRegion)
        In the abstract GameCard class, this method returns the default behavior of a policy card (isEligibleToVote() = false if the policy is automatic and true for any region if not automatic). If a class extending GameCard requires different behavior, then it must override this method.
        Parameters:
        playerRegion - being queried.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the given playerRegion is eligible to vote on this particular policy

      • clearVotes

      • addEnactingRegion

        public void addEnactingRegion(EnumRegion region)
        The Server is responsible for verifying and setting each enacting region of all policy cards requiring a vote (votesRequired() > 0).

        Each policy sent to the simulator must be enacted by at least one US region.

        Automatic policies are always and only enacted by the region who played the policy card.

        Some policy cards that require voting may be enacted by more than one region. In some cases, only the regions that voted for the policy enact it. In other cases (generally for international policies) either all US regions enact the policy or none do.
        Parameters:
        region - a United States region that will be enacting the policy.

      • didVoteYes

        public boolean didVoteYes(EnumRegion region)
        Parameters:
        region - a United States region.
        Returns:
        true iff the given region voted to approve the policy.

      • getEnactingRegionCount

        public int getEnactingRegionCount()
        Returns:
        Number of US regions who voted yes for this policy.

      • getValidTargetRegions

        public EnumRegion[] getValidTargetRegions()
        The default is null (no target region required).
        Returns:
        An array of regions valid as the target region of this policyCard. Returns null if this card does not require a region.

      • getValidTargetFoods

        public EnumFood[] getValidTargetFoods()
        The default is null (no target food required).
        Returns:
        An array of food categories valid as the target food of this policyCard. Returns null if this card does not require a region.

      • getValidTargetCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnumPolicy> getValidTargetCards()
        The default is null (no target card required).
        Returns:
        An array of cards that are valid as the target card of this policyCard. Returns null if this card does not require a target card.

        Returns:

      • getPolicyName

      • validate

        public java.lang.String validate()
        This method provides general validation checking of the policy card.

        Between the time when a GameCard is instantiated and drafted, it must have various fields set. Which fields must be set and the ranges of those fields is dependant on each particular subclass of GameCard.

        GameCard subclasses that need validation beyond what can be inferred from it's required fields should override this class, but open the override with super.validate(). Note: A policy that requires votes, may not have sufficient votes to be enacted, yet it may still be valid.

        The Server uses this method to validate policy cards sent by the client.
        Note: The client should never send the server invalid cards. If the simulator does find an error then either there is a bug in the client or the client has been hacked.

        After the Server validates a drafted policy card, if the policy requires voting, the Server must notify the client that the card is part of the voting phase. The Server must call didVoteYes(EnumRegion region) or each region that votes yes for the drafted policy.

        The Server must determine if a vote requiring policy is enacted and notify the clients.

        Additionally, at the end of the voting phase, the Server must tell the simulator which voting policies did not get enacted (by calling the simulator's discard(EnumRegion playerRegion, GameCard card) method.
        Returns:
        null if the policy is valid. Otherwise, returns an error message.
